title: Ticket #5682: Some real values printed incorrectly in ClassAds
description:
In 8.1.2, we changed how floating point values are printed in ClassAds to be more human readable. But for certain values, the printed value had an extra ".0" appended to the end such that the value causes a failure when re-parsed.

This problem occurs when a value has one digit of mantissa and a large (positive or negative) exponent, for example 2E40. This ends up being rendered as 2E40.0. This only occurs when unparsing in old ClassAds format.
